intro: Geissanthus fallenae, commonly known as the Galápagos sunflower, is a flowering plant native to the Galápagos Islands. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its vibrant yellow flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to the unique climate of the Galápagos. It has small, oval-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. Due to its restricted habitat, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
